metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19068 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A memory leak in the rtl8xxxu_submit_int_urb() function indrivers/net/wireless/realtek/rtl8xxxu/rtl8xxxu_core.c in the Linux kernelthrough 5.3.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) by triggering usb_submit_urb() failures, aka CID-a2cdd07488e6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-kvm - 4.4.0-1066.73
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.113
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1063-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-azure - 4.15.0-1075.80
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1058-gcp - 4.15.0-1058.62
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1035-oracle - 4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.138').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
